intro: Commelina virginica var. australis, commonly known as the Florida spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Commelina genus in the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue-violet flowers that bloom throughout the growing season, typically from spring to summer. It thrives in moist, sunny environments such as wetlands and disturbed soils. Its rapid growth and ability to spread through rhizomes make it both a common weed and an important component of wetland ecosystems.
